article:
We lived in a very quiet neighborhood. Earlier that evening my wife had asked me to go to the   _  to get some soft drinks. It seemed like this would be a good
time to let my teenage daughter Holly practice her  _  ,
so I sent her to the store in my truck.
  At dinner my    _  talked about how much he liked my truck. I enjoyed having it, but I
said: "Guy, my heart is not set on that truck. I like it but it is just metal
and  _  last forever.  _  set your
heart on anything that won't last.
  After hearing the loud noise, the whole family ran outside. My son shouted; " Dad! Dad, Holly crashed your truck."
  My heart    _  and my mind was flooded with  _  thoughts.
Was anyone hurt? Who else was involved? As I ran to the door, I heard a voice
in my heart say: "Here is a chance to show Holly  _  you
really love. She'll never forget it."
  The    _  had occurred in my own driveway. Holly had  _  my
truck into our family van  . In her   _  , she had confused the brakes and the
gas pedal. Holly was unhurt  _  but when I reached her,
she was crying and saying " Oh, Dad, I'm sorry. I know how much you love this
truck." I held her in my arms as she cried.
  Later that week a friend asked what had   _  to my truck. I told her the whole
story. Her eyes moistened  and she said: " That happened to me when I was a girl. I ruined my dad's car. When I got home , my dad knocked me    _  the
ground and began to kick me."
  Over 40 years later, she still felt the   _  of the night. It was a  _  wound on her soul.
  I remember how   _  Holly was the night she crashed our truck, and how I  _  her.
One day, when Holly  thinks back  on her life, I want her to know
that I love her a thousand times more than any piece of  _  .
